headline: What AES (AES)'s Data Center Utility Deals and Dividend Move Mean For Shareholders
summary: In recent weeks, The AES Corporation received analyst upgrades from Argus and Jefferies, both citing growing data center electricity demand and new agreements for over 2.1 GW at its regulated utilities in Indiana and Ohio, while its Board also declared a quarterly dividend of US$0.17595 per share payable to shareholders of record on January 30, 2026. These endorsements highlight how AES’s regulated utilities are becoming an important platform for capturing long-term data center growth,...

headline: AES (AES): Valuation Check After Analyst Upgrades on Data Center and EV-Driven Growth Prospects
summary: Recent analyst upgrades on AES (AES) are all circling the same theme: data center and EV driven power demand in the Midwest is accelerating, and the company is building infrastructure to capture it. See our latest analysis for AES. The market seems to be picking up on that story, with AES’s roughly 7 percent 90 day share price return and 13.8 percent one year total shareholder return suggesting that sentiment is improving after a tougher multi year stretch. If you are looking beyond utilities...
